variants.Description in input context: G2019S mutation causing structural changes in LRRK2, associated with Parkinson's disease (PD).
G2019S mutation causing structural changes in LRRK2, associated with Parkinson's disease (PD).

Material used.Description: The KESTREL screening identified phosphorylation sites in LRRK2, validated using kinase activity measurements.

Readout description.Result Description: Phosphorylation levels increased 200% compared to control samples.

Biological replicates.Description: Rat brain tissue samples were tested across three independent replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: Phosphorylation levels were measured across triplicate samples.

Basic positive control.Description: Phosphorylation levels were compared to normal controls in the same rat.

Basic negative control.Description: Phosphorylation levels were compared to negative control samples in the same rat.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression greater than 80% on day 7.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression less than 50% on day 7.
